snippet.title: Bubsy Two-Fur - PC / SNES Gameplay (Steam)
snippet.description:
Many thought Bubsy was lost to a legacy of shame obscurity after his cat-astrophic venture into 3-D, but he’s been given a new shot at video-game stardom with his first release of this meowllenium: Bubsy Two-Fur!

Bubsy Two-Fur is the authorized digital download version of Bubsy’s first two games, and the first official Bubsy release since 1997! Relive the games that started the notorious career of Bubsy Bobcat in their original incarnations, and experience for yourself the cat-titude and purr-sonality of the first gaming mascot to have a digitized (and unforgettable) voice, one whose words still resound in the minds of all who played his games: “What could paw-sibly go wrong?”

Bubsy, Bubsy II, Bubsy Two-Fur, Accolade (C) Atari
Retroism (C) Tommo Inc.
Developed by Accolade
Published by Retroism

#retrogaming #retrogames #steam #steamgames #steamgame #bubsy #bubsytwofur #bubsyii #bubsy2 #atari #bubsyisback #tommoinc #retroism #accolade

NOTE: Unlike the newly announced Bubsy in: The Purrfect Collection, which is being developed by Limited Run Games using their signature Carbon Engine, Bubsy Two-Fur is a simple port of the first two SNES games using an open source emulator, Snes9x. Rumor has it that Piko Interactive was involved with the emulation process, but frankly I can't remember if it's true or not. And since LRG's collection will also have both Bubsy 3D and the lesser-known Game Boy port of Bubsy II, there is a good chance that Two-Fur will be delisted from Steam in the future. After all, Two-Fur was released at the time when Accolade IPs were owned by Tommo Inc under the Retroism brand.
